title: Dame Diana Rigg to play outspoken Duchess in ITV's royal drama Victoria
text:

Former Bond girl Dame Diana Rigg is to join the cast of ITV ’s royal drama Victoria. 
The veteran actress – best known for her 60s role in The Avengers - will appear alongside Jenna Coleman, who reprises her role as the monarch, and Tom Hughes, who returns as Prince Albert. 
Game Of Thrones star Dame Diana, 78, will play the Duchess of Buccleuch, the young Queen’s new Mistress of the Robes, who is “renowned for speaking her mind”. 
Queen Victoria faces the challenge of motherhood in the new ITV series. Read More James Nesbitt gets SOAKED while filming Cold Feet as his character sparks baby rumours Diana as Emma Peel in her famous catsuit (Photo: Rex Features) 
Taking place six weeks after the first series ended, the second instalment establishes Victoria as a working mother, “learning to balance her responsibilities as both parent and Queen”. 
However Prince Albert is still struggling to find a role for himself , leading to power struggles with his wife. 
The drama’s creator, Daisy Goodwin, said: “Victoria is the only Queen Regnant to marry and give birth while on the throne and the challenges of being head of state as well as a wife and mother are legion. With Avengers co-star Patrick Macnee (Photo: PA) 
“In many ways, Victoria’s dilemma is a modern one - how do you have a successful marriage and a happy family when you are holding down an important job. Can you really have it all?” 
Executive producer Damien Timmer said of the new series: “At the centre of it is a beautifully nuanced study of a young marriage, and it’s a joy to watch Jenna and Tom find new layers to this iconic couple.” Read More Fans praise "beautiful" and "radiant" Lisa Riley as she unveils post-surgery look on Loose Women Jenna Coleman as the young Victoria (Photo: PA) 
The eight-part series and two-hour Christmas special will feature drama in Buckingham Palace , as well as the couple’s trips to France and Germany and see Victoria and Albert discover sanctuary in the Isle of Wight. 
The first series came out on top in a head-to-head with BBC1 ’s Poldark and was ITV’s highest rating drama of 2016. 
The show’s stars, Coleman and Hughes, became a real-life couple after filming the first instalment. Like us on Facebook
